member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Media.Export.G64ConverterBase.BeginConversion
member.summary: Begins the conversion asynchronously. If the given file at initialization has different resolutions, a new output file will be created every time the resolution changes. The output file name will be modified slightly.
member.example:
If the following path was given at initialization: C:\test.asf The result of having 3 different resolutions in the G64/G64X file will give 3 resulting output files: 1- C:\test.asf 2- C:\test_1.asf 3- C:\test_2.asf
If the given file at initialization has different resolutions, a new output file will be created every time the resolution changes. The output file name will be modified slightly.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Media.MediaPlayer.AddToSynchronizedPlayback
member.summary:
Add this media player in the synchronized playback group.
Adding a player to the synchronized playback group will change the state of that player to reflect the position, direction and all other playback properties shared by the group.
Further commands on any other member of the group will be propagated to the rest of the group.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Media.MediaPlayer.RemoveFromSynchronizedPlayback
member.summary: Remove this media player from the synchronized playback group it was previously added to.

member.summary: Sets the view window (digital zoom).
member.param: The left coordinate of the rendering dimension in pixels.
The top coordinate of the rendering dimension in pixels.
The width of the rendering dimension in pixels.
The height of the rendering dimension in pixels.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Media.MediaPlayerSynchronizer
member.summary:
MediaPlayerSynchronizer is responsible for synchronizing the playback of a set of Media Players.
USAGE: Register a MediaPlayer to the MediaPlayerSynchronizer by calling the RegisterMediaPlayer method and pass in the instance of the MediaPlayer that you want synchronized. Unregister a registered MediaPlayer from the MediaPlayerSynchronizer by calling the UnregisterMediaPlayer method and pass in the instance of the MediaPlayer that you want to unregister.
Playback commands can be sent to either the synchronized MediaPlayers or to the MediaPlayerSynchronizer. The MediaPlayerSynchronizer will propagate the commands to the other MediaPlayers.
All MediaPlayers will synchronize to the state of the currently synchronized MediaPlayers. i.e. MediaPlayer 1 is registered and is currently playing in rewind. MediaPlayer 2 is currently playing in live. If MediaPlayer 2 is registered to the same MediaPlayerSynchronizer, it will change its state to match the existing MediaPlayer.
A MediaPlayer that is unregistered from the MediaPlayerSynchronizer will keep its current state and will no longer be synchronized with the other MediaPlayers that are still registered to the MediaPlayerSynchronizer. i.e. MediaPlayer 1, 2 and 3 are currently paused. MediaPlayer 2 is unregistered from the MediaPlayerSynchronizer. MediaPlayer 2 will keep its paused state until it is changed. If MediaPlayer 2 changes its state, it will not be reflected on Media Player 1 or 3 and vice versa.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Media.PublicMediaPlayerProxy.PlayOutBufferCache
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the play-out buffer. (Commonly called the De-Jittering buffer). This can be configured when there is a packet delay variation (jitter) on the stream received. This setting needs to be changed on startup of the application.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Media.PublicMediaPlayerProxy.AllowSharedPlayback
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether shared playback accross multiple media players is allowed.
member.value: true if shared playback is to be allowed; otherwise, false.
member.exception: The VideoSourceFilter must not be initialized before changing the AllowSharedPlayback property.
member.remarks:
Use this property to disable shared video playback prior to initialization. It is enabled by default and should be disabled when using the source filter for more than a few shared streams.
Under normal circumstances, multiple instances displaying the same video feed on a workstation will use the same local playback cache on disk. However, due to the nature of the cacheing mechanism this is only appropriate if no more than two or three instances are likely to watch the same feed at a time. If, as with web and server side applications, it is possible that the number of requests for the same feed to exceed two or three shared playback should be disabled.
Note that this property can only be set prior to initialization of the video source filter.

member.name: E:Genetec.Sdk.Media.PublicMediaPlayerProxy.LivePlaybackModeToggled
member.summary:
Event raised whenever the player is switching from live to playback or vice versa. Read the IsPlayingLiveStream property when this event is fired to know in which mode the player has switched.
Please note that when is called while playing live stream, it will not go in playback. It will pause in the buffer from the live.
The event might be fired twice depending on the state of the and if it is already playing live.

member.summary: Initialize the media player engine with the source to its media.
member.param: The sdk engine, which should be logged on.
The camera guid.
Stream type to be used for live.
The client subnet guid, for route resolving purpose.
The MAC address on which to bind the stream connections.

remarks.para: This method can be used when trying to access a camera streams of an Auxiliary Archiver for playback
The client subnet guid can be retrieve using ConfigTool in the Network view task. It is the guid of the Network type used.
The StreamingType is only usefull when in PlayLive mode. This type is useless when using the VideoSourceFilter in playback mode.

example.code: PhysicalAddress networkAdapterBinding = NetworkInterface.GetAllNetworkInterfaces()[0].GetPhysicalAddress(); videoSource.Initialize(m_sdkEngine, camera.Guid, new Guid("ab5023a4-47cc-48e6-8242-ac0acd2f93c4"), StreamingType.Live, networkAdapterBinding);

remarks.para: Usage of this class requires the Media SDK lisense option.

member.summary: This event is fired every time the BitRate property changes.

member.summary: This event is fired every time the buffering progress changes.

member.summary: This event is fired if the buffering write capacity becomes too slow for the stream being cached.

member.summary: This event is fired every time a frame is rendered

The height of the new dimension

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Media.Web.IWebMediaPlayerEvents.LiveCachingDisabled
member.summary: This event is fired if for some reason, live caching is automatically disabled. This can happen if buffering space is maxed out and live caching cannot continue.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Media.Web.IWebMediaPlayerEvents.PlaybackSequenceListRetreived
member.summary: This event is fired when the playbacks sequence list is retreived.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Media.Web.IWebMediaPlayerEvents.PlayOutBufferCacheNotBigEnough
member.summary: This event is fired when the play out buffer cache is not big enough for the current network jitter

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Media.Web.IWebMediaPlayerEvents.PlayOutBufferCacheOverflow
member.summary: This event is fired when the play out buffer cache is being overflowed. This could cause the impression of a memory leak. But the problem is higher than this, if this is happening, it means the camera is not sending at the right pace. Its sending faster than its setted sampling frequency. The only known workaround for this is to deactivate play out buffering or change the sampling rate of the camera for the right one if its possible.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Media.Web.IWebMediaPlayerEvents.Started
member.summary: This event is fired when the first frame has been rendered

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Media.Web.IWebMediaPlayerEvents.Stopped
member.summary: This event is fired when the stream is stopped

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Media.Web.IWebMediaPlayerEvents.SwitchedFromLiveCacheToPlaybackCache
member.summary: This event is fired when we're rewinding in the live cache and we reach the beginning of it, the player will automatically start playing the playback data from that position and video glitches may appear. This event will be fired at this moment to inform the end user that the cache switch is happening.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Media.Web.IWebMediaPlayerEvents.LivePlaybackModeToggled
member.summary: This event is fired whenever the player is switching from live to playback or vice versa. Read the IsPlayingLiveStream property when this event is fired to know in which mode the player has switched.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Media.Web.WebMediaPlayer
member.summary:
The WebMediaPlayer worked until we started using Mixed mode assemblies (to use v3.5 with v4.0) Heres the note from MSDN concerning ActiveX running in IE with mixed mode assemblies :
Note: (ref.: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/65y5x3xf.aspx) COM applications hosted by an extensible host, such as Microsoft Internet Explorer or Microsoft Office cannot control which version of the runtime is loaded.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Media.DecodedFrameContent
member.summary: Class that encapsulates the content of a decoded video frame. Note: This class implements IDisposable; call Dispose to release unmanaged resources and avoid memory leaks.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Media.DecodedFrameContent.Data
member.summary: Gets an array of bytes that exposes the decoded frame data. Actual content may be smaller than the length of the data array. Read the property to know how much bytes are actually used in this array.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Media.DecodedFrameContent.DataSize
member.summary: Gets the size in bytes of the frame data in the property

member.summary: Gets the decoded frame format specification.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Media.DecodedFrameContent.Height
member.summary: Gets the height of the decoded picture.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating if this instance is not usable.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Media.DecodedFrameContent.Rgb32Stride
member.summary: Gets the stride of the picture if the color mode is Rgb32, otherwise this returns 0. In this case, the stride is defined as the width of the picture, in pixels. The stride in bytes can be obtained by multiplying this value by 4 (RGBA)

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Media.DecodedFrameContent.StrideUV
member.summary: Gets the stride of the U and V component of the picture, if the color mode is YUV, otherwise this returns 0. The stride is the number of bytes from one row of pixels in memory to the next row of pixels in memory. Stride is also called pitch.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Media.DecodedFrameContent.StrideY
member.summary: Gets the stride of the Y component of the picture, if the color mode is YUV, otherwise this returns 0. The stride is the number of bytes from one row of pixels in memory to the next row of pixels in memory. Stride is also called pitch.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Media.DecodedFrameContent.U
member.summary: Gets the pointer of the U data in the data array, if the color mode is YUV, otherwise this returns IntPtr.Zero.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Media.DecodedFrameContent.V
member.summary: Gets the pointer of the V data in the data array, if the color mode is YUV, otherwise this returns IntPtr.Zero.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Media.DecodedFrameContent.Width
member.summary: Gets the width of the decoded picture.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Media.DecodedFrameContent.Y
member.summary: Gets the pointer of the Y data in the data array, if the color mode is YUV, otherwise this returns IntPtr.Zero.

member.summary: Encoded frame content. Can be set to null when the data is blocked for the current user's security level. Check with the IsBlocked property. This EncodedFrameContent instance must be disposed for each event invocation, or else memory leak will occur. Call the Dispose method explicitly after usage

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Media.EncodedFrameReceivedEventArgs.IsHidden
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this video frame should be hidden.
member.value: true if this frame should be hidden; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Hidden frames are typically received during seek operations when the video engine is advancing to a specified time index. In order to render from the exact index requested, the engine will begine rendering from the next earliest key frame and advance rapidly to the frame in question. All intervening frames will be marked as hidden indicating that they should not be displayed to the user.
